newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine 91-day T-bill rate rises to 12.175 pct.
newsitem.headline: Philippine 91-day T-bill rate rises to 12.175 pct.

text.p: The benchmark 91-day Treasury bill rate rose to an average of 12.175 percent from 10.969 percent at the weekly auction on Monday, the Bureau of Treasury reported.
The other term rates also increased after the Central Bank on Monday lifted its overnight borrowing rate to 30 percent from 24 percent to quell a fresh round of attack on the peso.
The 182-day rate jumped to 12.535 percent from 11.343 percent; and the 364-day rate rose to 13.183 percent from 11.683 percent.
The auction drew 12.59 billion pesos of tenders, of which only 3.1 billion pesos were accepted because of the high bid rates. The government had targetted to sell five billion pesos of the T-bills.
"The committee felt the rates given were rather too much. We can afford to reject that," National Treasurer Caridad Valdehuesa told reporters.
